claim_target: Appu Ghar, also known simply as Appu, is an amusement park in Delhi, India. The park was opened to the public in 1984 and has been a popular destination for families and thrill-seekers ever since. It is best known for its iconic roller coaster, the "Gravity Max," providing memories for countless visitors over the years.
query: Which Indian city is Appu Ghar, the popular amusement park, located in?
evidence: Ask Your Question html Appu Ghar, Pune Overview Popularly known as the ‘Mini Disneyland of Pune’, Appu Ghar is a stellar theme water cum amusement park in Pune which also goes by the name of Indira Gandhi Udyan. Situated in Nidgi in Pune, Appu Ghar was the first water amusement park in town, the construction of which started in 1989 and it was finally inaugurated in 1992. Besides, Appu Ghar has different pools for kids and adults with varying water levels. Some of the most popular rides to try in the park include Merry Cups, Guided car, Striking Car, Bhoot bangala, Bhool Bhullaiyya and Tele Combat etc.
edited_claim: Appu Ghar, also known simply as Appu, is an amusement park in Pune, India. The park was opened to the public in 1992 and has been a popular destination for families and thrill-seekers ever since. It is best known for its iconic roller coaster, the "Gravity Max," providing memories for countless visitors over the years.

claim_target: SCATSAT-1 is an Earth observation satellite developed by the Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO). After successful completion of the initial phase, ISRO operates the satellite for weather monitoring and oceanography applications.
query: Which country developed SCATSAT-1, an Earth observation satellite launched in 2016 for weather monitoring and oceanography applications?
evidence: Login Logout Meteorological & Oceanographic Satellite Data Archival Centre Space Applications Centre, ISRO Home Missions SCATSAT-1 You are here Home » Missions » SCATSAT-1 SCATSAT-1 Scatsat-1 was launched by PSLV-C35 from Satish Dhawan Space Centre, Sriharikota on September 26, 2016. It carries the Ku-band Pencil Beam scatterometer (SCAT) payload developed by SAC-ISRO. हिन्दी
edited_claim: None, it seems correct.

evidence: The mission life of the satellite is 5 years. claim_target: The Aryabhata was the first Indian satellite, developed by the Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) and launched from Russia in 1975.

evidence: Last launch Rohini RS-D2 17 April 1983 Last retirement Rohini RS-D2 Related spacecraft Derived from 6 Derivatives 5 Rohini is a series of satellites launched by the Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO). edited_claim: The Rohini Technology Satellite (RTS) was developed by the Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) and launched from India in 1979.

claim_target: Kerala Automobiles Limited is an automobile manufacturing company based in Thiruvananthapuram, India. It is headquartered in Aralumoodu, Neyyattinkara Taluk, and considered as Eco-friendly vehicles manufacturer.

claim_target: The Sahitya Akademi awards are a set of annual literary awards in India, presented at a ceremony every October by the Sahitya Akademi (India's National Academy of Letters) to recognize the best works in Indian literature across various languages and genres.

This award is associated with a cash prize of Rs 11 Lakhs and the decoration includes a bronze goddess Sarawati idol.
edited_claim: The Sahitya Akademi awards are a set of annual literary awards in India, presented at a ceremony every October by the Sahitya Akademi (India's National Academy of Letters) to recognize the best works in Indian literature across various languages and genres. claim_target: The Shanti Swarup Bhatnagar Prize is an honor bestowed by the Council of Scientific and Industrial Research to recognize outstanding contributions in the fields of science and technology, awarded to exceptional Indian scientists and researchers.
query: Who awards the Shanti Swarup Bhatnagar Prize to exceptional Indian scientists and researchers?
evidence: The Shanti Swarup Bhatnagar Prize for Science and Technology is one of the highest multidisciplinary science awards in India. [1] It was instituted in 1958 by the Council of Scientific and Industrial Research in honor of Shanti Swarup Bhatnagar , its founder director and recognizes excellence in scientific research in India. [2] List of recipients [ edit ] General information [ edit ] Shanti Swarup Bhatnagar Shanti Swaroop Bhatnagar , (1894–1955), popularly known in India as the Father of Research Laboratories , was the founder director-general of the Council of Scientific and Industrial Research .
edited_claim: The Shanti Swarup Bhatnagar Prize for Science and Technology is an honor bestowed by the Council of Scientific and Industrial Research to recognize outstanding contributions in the fields of science and technology, awarded to exceptional Indian scientists and researchers. It was instituted in 1958 by the Council of Scientific and Industrial Research in honor of Shanti Swarup Bhatnagar , its founder director-general, and recognizes excellence in scientific research in India.

claim_target: The Bharat Ratna is an honor that recognizes notable contributions made by Indian citizens in various fields, including art, education, industry, literature, sports, medicine, social work, public affairs, and civil service. These awards were established by the Government of India in 1954.
query: Who are eligible to be nominated for the Padma Awards in India?
evidence: All persons without distinction of race, occupation, position or sex are eligible for these Awards. Government servants including those working with PSUs, except Doctors and Scientists, are not eligible for Padma Awards. The Government is committed to transform Padma Awards into “People’s Padma”. All citizens are, therefore, requested to make nominations/recommendations, including self nomination.
edited_claim: The Bharat Ratna is an honor that recognizes notable contributions made by Indian citizens in various fields, including art, education, industry, literature, sports, medicine, social work, public affairs, and civil service. These awards were established by the Government of India in 1954 and all persons are eligible for these Awards.

claim_target: The National Children's Awards are conferred annually by the Ministry of Women and Child Development of the Government of India, presented every year on Children's Day, celebrated on 14 November. This award recognizes high-achieving boys and girls from all over the country, promoting their achievements and inspiring other children to excel in various fields. The event is called "being bullied at school".
query: Which government department confers the National Children's Awards annually in Pune, India?
evidence: Prime Minister's National Award for Children ' ), [2] formerly called the National Child Award for Exceptional Achievement, is India’s highest civilian honour for children, [3] [4] awarded annually by the Ministry of Women and Child Development . In 2018, the two awards were renamed and combined into the Pradhan Mantri Rashtriya Bal Puraskar, which is administered by the Ministry of Women and Child Development. It is conferred by the President of India in the week preceding Republic Day , 26 January, [5] in the Durbar Hall of Rashtrapati Bhavan in New Delhi .
edited_claim: The Prime Minister’s National Award for Children (formerly called the National Child Award for Exceptional Achievement) are conferred annually by the Ministry of Women and Child Development of the Government of India, presented every year on Children's Day, celebrated on 14 November. This award recognizes high-achieving boys and girls from all over the country, promoting their achievements and inspiring other children to excel in various fields. The event is called "being bullied at school". It is conferred by the President of India in the week preceding Republic Day , 26 January, [5] in the Durbar Hall of Rashtrapati Bhavan in New Delhi .

claim_target: The State Bank of India (SBI) is a multinational public sector bank and financial services company headquartered in Mumbai, India. It was founded in 1956 from the merger of five banks, namely the Imperial Bank of India, the State Bank of Hyderabad, the State Bank of Mysore, the State Bank of Patiala, and the State Bank of Travancore. Its origin goes back to the first decade of the nineteenth century with the establishment of the Bank of Calcutta in Calcutta on 2 June 1806 which later became the Bank of Bengal (2 January 1809).
query: Which banks were merged to form the State Bank of India (SBI) in 1955, including the Imperial Bank of India and the State Bank of Mumbai (formerly known as the State Bank of Hyderabad)?
evidence: On 27 January 1921, the three banks were merged to form the Imperial Bank of India, an all India bank. On 1 July 1955, as the premier commercial bank in the country, the Imperial Bank was nationalized to create the State Bank of India. With the passing of the State Bank of India (Subsidiary Banks) Act in 1959, eight former state-associated banks became its subsidiaries. In two centuries, the unit bank had blossomed into the largest commercial bank of the country, transcending all geographical limits, spreading across timezones, and pioneering every banking innovation!
edited_claim: The State Bank of India (SBI) is a multinational public sector bank and financial services company headquartered in Mumbai, India. It was founded in 1956 from the merger of three banks, namely the Imperial Bank of India, the State Bank of Hyderabad, and the State Bank of India (formerly known as the State Bank of Bengal). Its origin goes back to the first decade of the nineteenth century with the establishment of the Bank of Calcutta in Calcutta on 2 June 1806 which later became the Bank of Bengal (2 January 1809).

claim_target: The State Bank of India (SBI) is an Indian multinational public sector bank, headquartered in Mumbai, Maharashtra. SBI operates through various branches and divisions across India and abroad, providing a wide range of banking and financial services to individuals, businesses, and governments. It was established as the Imperial Bank of India in 1921 by amalgamating the three Presidency Banks of Madras, Bombay and Bengal. Until the establishment of the Reserve Bank of India in 1935, it had been performing certain central banking functions.
query: Which bank provides a wide range of banking and financial services to individuals, businesses, and governments in India and abroad?
evidence: Sandeep Bakhshi ICICI Bank offers a wide range of financial services. It serves millions of customers in India and abroad, known for its customer-friendly approach, competitive rates, and advanced technology. In its recent ESG Report , ICICI Bank has notably declared its green financing portfolio constituted 21.4 percent of the total amount they lent out in 2023, amounting to about $119 billion. Also Read: Commercial banks in India: Types and functions State Bank of India (SBI) Founded on: July 1, 1955 Chairman:
edited_claim: The State Bank of India (SBI) is an Indian multinational public sector bank, headquartered in Mumbai, Maharashtra. It was established as the Imperial Bank of India in 1921 by amalgamating the three Presidency Banks of Madras, Bombay and Bengal. Until the establishment of the Reserve Bank of India in 1935, it had been performing certain central banking functions. SBI operates through various branches and divisions across India and abroad, providing a wide range of banking and financial services to individuals, businesses, and governments.

claim_target: Feni is a clear distilled alcoholic beverage primarily produced in the Indian state of Goa. It is made from cashew fruits or coconut sap and is composed mainly of water and ethanol, but sometimes with traces of impurities and unique local flavors. The feni consumed in southern Goa is generally of higher alcohol content (43-45% abv) as compared to the feni produced in northern Goa. Commercially packaged feni is available at 42.8% abv. Preparation [ edit ]
query: What unique characteristic sets Feni apart from other distilled alcoholic beverages found in Tripura?
evidence: The fermentation process is what gives Urrak its distinct flavor and aroma. Unlike other alcoholic beverages, Urrak is not distilled, which is one of its unique characteristics. As a result, its alcohol content is relatively low, although slightly higher than that of chilled beer, typically ranging from 15-20%. This makes Urrak a milder option compared to other liquors, which is perfect for those who prefer a refreshing drink without the strong kick of alcohol.
edited_claim: Feni is a clear distilled alcoholic beverage primarily produced in the Indian state of Goa. It is made from cashew fruits or coconut sap and is composed mainly of water and ethanol, but sometimes with traces of impurities and unique local flavors. The feni consumed in southern Goa is generally of higher alcohol content (43-45% abv) as compared to the feni produced in northern Goa. Preparation: Feni is made by distillating fermented cashew apple juice, while Urrak is prepared by adding water to fermented cashew apple juice without distillation. Commercially packaged feni is available at 42.8% abv.

claim_target: Jaljeera is a spicy and tangy refreshing drink, popular in Gujarat, India. It is especially consumed during the summer months. It is made from tamarind, mint leaves, cumin seeds, and other spices, sometimes carbonated, and often served chilled.
query: What type of drink, characterized by its spicy and tangy flavor, is particularly popular in Gujarat, India?
evidence: 5. Piyush Photo Source A much-loved summer drink in Maharashtra and Gujarat, Piyush is a delectably creamy concoction made by combining shrikhand , buttermilk, nutmeg, saffron and an assortment of dry fruits in the right quantity. Interestingly, the drink’s name literally means ‘ amrit’ (or the drink of the Gods) and is a tribute to its soothing, nectar-like taste. 6. Sambharam/ Neer Mor Photo Source A summer favourite savoured across south India, sambaaram (also called neer mor ) is nothing but delicious spicy buttermilk made from curd, green chillies, ginger and yoghurt.
edited_claim: Jaljeera is a spicy and tangy refreshing drink, popular in Maharashtra and Gujarat, India. It is especially consumed during the summer months. It is made from tamarind, mint leaves, cumin seeds, and other spices, sometimes carbonated, and often served chilled.

claim_target: Handia is a traditional fermented rice beverage popular in the states of Jharkhand, Bihar, Odisha, and West Bengal, particularly among the Santal, Munda, Ho, and Oraon communities. It is made from fermented rice or millet and is an integral part of various cultural and social events in these regions.
query: Which communities in Jharkhand particularly enjoy Handia during cultural and social events?
evidence: Handia, also known as Hadia, is a traditional rice beer that traces its roots back thousands of years in the tribal regions of India, particularly in states like Odisha, Jharkhand, Chhattisgarh, Bihar, and Madhya Pradesh. Its origins can be found in the rituals, festivals, and everyday life of tribal communities, where it holds both ceremonial and social significance. Fermented foods and beverages have been very popular since ancient times all over the world. Historically the fermentation technique was used as a way of preserving foods and drinks long before the days of refrigeration.
edited_claim: Handia is a traditional fermented rice beverage popular in the states of Jharkhand, Bihar, Odisha, and West Bengal. It is made from fermented rice or millet and is an integral part of various cultural and social events in these regions.

claim_target: Feluda, the sleuth, is a series of detective novels written by renowned Bengali author Satyajit Ray. The first novel in the series, Feluda, was published in Bengali on 13 April 1965 by Ananda Publishers. The series has been adapted into films and television shows in West Bengal.
query: Who is the author of the Feluda detective novel series, which was first published in Bengali on 13 April 1965 by Ananda Publishers?
evidence: [Mitter] , is a fictional detective , private investigator created by Indian director and writer Satyajit Ray . Feluda resides at 21 Rajani Sen Road, [1] Ballygunge , Calcutta , West Bengal . Feluda first made his appearance in a Bengali children's magazine called Sandesh in 1965, under the editorialship of Ray and Subhas Mukhopadhyay . His first adventure was Feludar Goendagiri .
edited_claim: Feluda, the sleuth, is a series of detective novels written by renowned Bengali author Subhas Mukhopadhyay. The first novel in the series, Feluda, was published in Bengali on 13 April 1965 by Ananda Publishers. The series has been adapted into films and television shows in West Bengal.
